Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • Level

  • public class Level
extends greenfoot.World
    This game was created as a part of the examination of the Uppsala University summer course Introduction to Programming with Java Originally created 2015-08-04. Updated 2019-01-24 to allow HTML5 conversion. The game is a platformer inspired by the old NES classics. The sounds effects have been generated at http://www.bfxr.net/ The music is created by me in FamiTracker. The sprites have been drawn in Paint and on http://www.piskelapp.com/ There is only one level class, where all the individual levels are gathered. They are generated by the arrays found at the bottom of the document.
    Version:
    2019-01-24
    Author:
    Aron Strandberg

        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.World

      • checkRespawn

        public void checkRespawn(boolean TF)
        The player respawn is found in this class. Allows a delay between death and respawn with no player on the screen
        Parameters:
        TF - boolean that is true after the delay counter has counted down after the player death

      • createKey

        public void createKey(int I,
                      int J)
        Parameters:
        I - Key x position in the createMap() for loop
        J - Key y position in the createMap() for loop

      • createMap

        public void createMap()
        Loop that generates the levels according to the arrays maps at the bottom.

      • createPlayer

        public void createPlayer(int I,
                         int J)
        Parameters:
        I - Player x position in the createMap() for loop
        J - Player y position in the createMap() for loop

      • rescale

        public void rescale(greenfoot.GreenfootImage[] graphics)
        Doubles the size of all objects in the game from 16x16 to 32x32. This applies to all graphic in the game. Assumes that all sprites in /images are 16x16 pixels
        Parameters:
        graphics - An array with all the images that are used in this class

      • setSong

        public void setSong(int i)
        Method that initiates the music for the current level
        Parameters:
        i - refers to the song order in the soundtrack array

      • skipLevel

        public void skipLevel()
        Cheat button "s" that works if allowLevelSkip has been set to true. Allows faster testing and debugging.
